abstract.p: OM Gruppen, Swedish technology company that runs Stockholm stock exchange, extends its offer to acquire London Stock Exchange to Oct 23 (S)

block.p: OM Gruppen, the Swedish technology company that runs the Stockholm stock exchange, said it had extended its offer to acquire the London Stock Exchange to Oct. 23. As of Monday, the original closing date of the offer, OM Gruppen said that it had received acceptances representing 300,000 London Stock Exchange shares, or about 1 percent of the shares outstanding. OM Gruppen urged shareholders of the exchange to vote in favor of lifting a restriction that limits holdings in the exchange to 4.9 percent; the vote is set for an Oct. 19 meeting. The restriction would have to be removed before OM Gruppen, or any other bidder, could win control of the exchange.

OM Gruppen, the Swedish technology company that runs the Stockholm stock exchange, said it had extended its offer to acquire the London Stock Exchange to Oct. 23. As of Monday, the original closing date of the offer, OM Gruppen said that it had received acceptances representing 300,000 London Stock Exchange shares, or about 1 percent of the shares outstanding. OM Gruppen urged shareholders of the exchange to vote in favor of lifting a restriction that limits holdings in the exchange to 4.9 percent; the vote is set for an Oct. 19 meeting. The restriction would have to be removed before OM Gruppen, or any other bidder, could win control of the exchange.
